summary: The document outlines the planned withdrawal of United Nations troops from the Congo by the end of 1963, a move opposed by Congolese Premier Cyrille Adoula. It explores the consideration of alternative financing methods to sustain a reduced UN troop presence, alongside debates on the UN Secretary General's capacity to accept external funding.
key_findings: Plans for the withdrawal of UN troops from the Congo by the end of 1963 were established.
Congolese Premier Cyrille Adoula was against the withdrawal.
Alternative financing options were explored to keep a reduced UN troop presence at 40-50% strength.
There was debate over the UN Secretary General's authority to accept outside funds.
